conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid as it flows from points A, B, and C.
Liquid starts at point A and flows downward.
Liquid encounters the first baffle (red) from point A.
The red baffle directs the flow to the right from point A.
Liquid continues flowing rightward until it hits the next baffle (green) from point A.
The green baffle directs the flow downward from point A.
Liquid flows straight down and enters container E from point A.
Liquid starts at point B and flows downward.
Liquid encounters the first baffle (green) from point B.
The green baffle directs the flow to the right from point B.
Liquid continues flowing rightward until it hits the next baffle (purple) from point B.
The purple baffle directs the flow downward from point B.
Liquid flows straight down and enters container D from point B.
Liquid starts at point C and flows downward.
Liquid encounters the first baffle (green) from point C.
The green baffle directs the flow to the right from point C.
Liquid continues flowing rightward until it hits the next baffle (purple) from point C.
The purple baffle directs the flow downward from point C.
Liquid flows straight down and enters container D from point C.
Flow paths from points A, B, and C are influenced by the baffles they encounter.
Baffles redirect the flow in specific directions, determining which container the liquid will enter.
Points B and C lead to container D due to the redirection by the purple baffle.
Point A leads to container E due to the redirection by the red and green baffles.
Liquid from points A, B, and C will flow into containers E, D, and D respectively.
